intro: Genista kepenensis, commonly known as the Kepen broom, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with a similar climate.
